lines.text:
[Coleman as Bobby]
Uh, you're Dinger, right?
Rigggght. Me Dinger, you Bobby. Me look cool; you look like shit, pal. It's okay, though. It's okay. We'll make it a fashion statement.
You're crazy. D'you know that?

[Coleman as Bobby]
And I'm also, uh... cute, too. Aren't I?
[first lines]
Dinger! Dinger, wake up for a minute. I gotta talk to you, Buddy.
Bobby, I'm asleep. I'm sound asleep, Bobby. I'm dreaming. Apache women. Mai-taih's. Vannah White and a whip.
I'm in love.
That could be a problem.
I don't think you understand.
No, no, I do understand. I really do. Which hand is it this week PAL?
You know, why does everything you have to say... You know, why does it have to revolve around sex? Why? Why are you so perverted?
Ohhh, no milk, no cookies, nothing.
You see, I like it here. It's... well, it's dreamy, if you catch my drift, ah-ha-ha!
"Heh" - that's the way I laugh. You know - "Heh!"
What the Hell is "Heh?" Why can't you laugh like a man?

[Coleman as Bobby]
Why do we have to take something so far that it can't be taken back? I'll tell you why - because we're young, and when you're young, every little thing seems so big.

[sitting alone in Joel's car, waiting]
Wow... shit's gotten weird. Me, Dinger - this unbelievably-looking guy - is sitting out here, freezing my ass off in some butt-ugly red Mustang. Well, now I have ample time?
[looks down at wrist]

I don't have a watch, I never had a watch. Why did I look at my wrist? At the dance. Dancing perfectly. With a hot chick. She wanted me. I know she wanted me. Well, every girl wants me. I should be in Hawaii drinking a piña colada, looking at some Hawaii chick. "Hello, honey."
Wait a second, boys! Man, it's a party! Who's got the chips?
Thank you for a frightening, confusing, strange and dangerous time. What more could a girl ask for?
That's right. Messin' with Rambo's little brother. That's right. Woo-hoo, dust, pal. Dust. First mistake.
You were expecting, maybe... Freddy Krueger?
Who's Freddy Krueger?
It's before your time.
when you pack, leaving usually tends to follow.
Hey, buddy, school's that way. Yonder!
I'm every girl's type.
You mean "dumb-ass." It might be a foreign object, but it ain't in French, dude.
Wow, I always thought SAT meant Saturday Afternoon Test. What is up?
Why am I running? I have... a broken... leg.

[playing an air guitar against his cane]
Dyeh dyiroo-dyeh dyeh!
Ohhhh, our life is tough.
Dyeh dyiroo dyeh dyeh!
Money never seems to be enough.
Dyeh dyeh, dyeh dyeh!
And if I could have, oh, just one thing...
Byeh, Byiroo-dyeh dyeh! Holy God, I wish you can sing.
No, no keep going. Now, ge... gimme... gimme more than that.
I'm flunking every grade in school.
Marvelous, so am I.
Penniless.
Gimme something better than that.
Okay, uh... my parents don't even talk to me.
Yeah, well at least your mom didn't run over your leg in her Volvo, right? Mine did.
Yeah, but see my mom doesn't go into spazticated seizures every once and again.
That's rude, mister.
Bobby, you know Joel's gonna find out about you and Lainie Monday morning at school. I-I-I tried to warn ya, but did you listen? No.

[Coleman as Bobby]
Yeah. Well, hopefully I won't be in school Monday.

That's a real good idea, pal. Real good. Bobby, let me ask you a question. Do you really honestly know what you're doing? No, no. Wait, wait, wait. Forget I asked. You obviously don't. You keep proving it to me.

[Coleman as Bobby, putting his arm around him]
Listen Dinger, I-I just want to say that, you know, I-I-I appreciate us being friends and everything, and-and-and you helped me through this.
I got it. You want money. That's what you want, right? Money.

[Coleman as Bobby]
No. No, not at all. I just... I just wanted to-to let you know that I appreciate you being my friend.
Bobby?

[Coleman as Bobby]
Yeah?
Dude, you turning fag on me or what? What's happening?
[Bobby comes home with a busted lip and a black eye]
Look at this.
Can you imagine what he's done now? Ask him if the police are very far behind him.
It's those no good friends of his.

[Coleman as Bobby]
The police are not behind me and it's not my friends, okay? My friends won't beat me up like this.
Ask him if I'm gonna get sued. Check out if he's got any teeth left. I can't afford the dental bills.

[Coleman as Bobby]
You know, it's no wonder I'm so screwed up! I mean, look at you guys. You don't even talk to me. I'm your son, remember? Why don't you ever give me the benefit of the doubt? You don't even ask me if anything's wrong. You don't even ask me if I'm hurt. I mean, what's the matter with you? You don't understand what it's like to be a kid in today's society! I'm trying my hardest! I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I screamed. It's just really upsetting. I-I try to do everything I can and I'm studying hard and I'm going to do good on my SATs on Saturday. I'm going to.
Yeah. Sure.

[Coleman as Bobby]
I mean, I'm working really hard. I just need you to help me. I cannot do this without you.
Okay.
Okay.

[Coleman as Bobby]
Goodnight, uh... Goodnight, Gus and... Kit. Goodnight.
Goodnight, honey.
[Bobby leaves the room]
When did he start calling us Gus and Kit?
How many times have I told you this is private property?
Everyday, sir.
Well, then why don't you go another way? "Foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds" - Emerson, 1841.
Stay off the grass! Look what you're doing to my lawn!
Oh, you don't have to thank us, sir. It was our pleasure.
Thanking you never entered my mind.
Be like the roots of a tree.
You be like a root. I feel like the sap.
What're you guys doin' in, uh, Dorkville?
Wow, speak of the Devil.
What d'you mean by that, Dinger?
Nothing. Me and Bobby were just talking about evil things and you guys happened to show up. Nothing at all.
I'm not in the mood for this shit, Dinger.
Well, I can only get so happy then I peak.
Where do you think you're going?
To run away from home and become a prostitute.
How dumb do you think I am?

[Coleman as Bobby]
I don't know. It's a pretty leading question. How dumb are ya?
It's your life. You have to live it.
Not anymore, thanks to you.
And, also, if you weren't so damned smart you would have figured this whole thing out two dreams ago.
YOU... don't seem to have any of the answers.
What do YOU know about all of this?
Shit. I'm just caught in a dream, and I don't even think it's mine.
Well, it certainly isn't mine.
Well, I'm not the one that was dickin' around with reality.
I don't care about you! I just want my wife back.
